column4: I can't edit my sources.list ?  it says timestamp too far in the future
the time it gives me is a little ove 4 hours in the future
sudo: timestamp too far in the future: Sep 28 03:14:53 2006
well, my computer has the correct time
I am having some problems with my C compiler, and I don't know much about it

well, chkdsk check a partition AFAIK... anyway, if you want to check an *entire* disk, then i assume it means you want to check for *physical* defects, like bad blocks or worse.  i don't know of any bad-sector-checking packages on Linux, but you might want to try smartmontools (run "smartctl -A /dev/hdwhatever") to see what your HD's health is like
that's -- of course -- a S.M.A.R.T. data monitoring program
it depends, "drivers" can be many things in ubuntu. what do you want to know?
uhm, i don't see any package mentioning them... they're probably a standard part of the kernel, i'd assume
well, *if* they're part of the kernel, then i'm afraid you'd just have to wait for a newer kernel. can't seem to find too much on google though
